#importing sklearn library for splitting data as train and test
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
x_train, x_test, y_train, y_test=train_test_split(x,y,test_size=0.18,random_state=42)
source.eab96a9e:
#importing logistic regression algorithm with sklearn library
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
lr=LogisticRegression()#creating logistic regression variable
lr.fit(x_train.T,y_train.T)#fitting and training the algorith with training datasets which are x_train, y_train
source.fe028913:
#finding accuracy and testing predicted values with testing part of data frame
y_prediction=lr.predict(x_test.T)
print("accuracy: ",lr.score(x_test.T,y_test.T))
print("test data : ",y_test)
print("prediction data : ",y_prediction)
source.89025bc1:
# creating confision matrix with sklearn library
from sklearn.metrics import confusion_matrix
c_mat = confusion_matrix(y_test,y_prediction)
print(c_mat)
source.94e0b4ac:
#calculating accuracy with confision matrix and see how succesful the alghoritm is
conf_score=(c_mat[0,0]+c_mat[1,1])/(c_mat[0,0]+c_mat[0,1]+c_mat[1,0]+c_mat[1,1])
print("confision accuracy score: ",conf_score)
source.5b6033c3:
# finding mcc score with using sklearn library
from sklearn.metrics import matthews_corrcoef
mcc=matthews_corrcoef(y_test,y_prediction)
print("mcc score: ",mcc)
